CodeList.Name: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form Questionnaires Parameter Code

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter code codelist for the Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form Questionnaires (CHART-SF) to support the calculation of subscores and total score for the Interview and Paper Versions in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours in a typical 24-hour day do you have someone with you to provide physical assistance for personal care activities such as eating, bathing, dressing, toileting and mobility? (hours paid assistance).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Paid Personal Care per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours in a typical 24-hour day do you have someone with you to provide physical assistance for personal care activities such as eating, bathing, dressing, toileting and mobility? hours unpaid (family, others).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Unpaid Personal Care per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How much time is someone with you in your home to assist you with activities that require remembering, decision making, or judgment?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Home Cognitive Assistance per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How much of the time is someone with you to help you with remembering, decision making, or judgment when you go away from your home?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Away Cognitive Assistance per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Hours Out of Bed per Day
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - On a typical day, how many hours are you out of bed?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours Out of Bed per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Days Out of the House per Week
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - In a typical week, how many days do you get out of your house and go somewhere?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Days Out of the House per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Nights Away From Home Last Year
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - In the last year, how many nights have you spent away from your home?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Nights Away From Home Last Year

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Hours of Paid Work per Week
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend working in a job for which you get paid?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours of Paid Work per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend working in a job for which you get paid? (occupation).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Occupation of Paid Work

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend in school working toward a degree or in an accredited technical training program?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours of Schoolwork per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend in active homemaking including parenting, housekeeping, and food preparation?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours of Homemaking per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Hours of Home Maintenance per Week
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend in home maintenance activities such as gardening, house repairs or home improvement?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours of Home Maintenance per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many hours per week do you spend in recreational activities such as sports, exercise, playing cards, or going to movies?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Hours of Recreation per Week

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Number of People You Live With
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many people do you live with?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Number of People You Live With

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Live With Spouse or Signif Other
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Is one of them your spouse or significant other?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Live With Spouse or Significant Other

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: CHSF-Number of Relatives You Live With
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Of the people you live with how many are relatives?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Number of Relatives You Live With

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many business or organizational associates do you visit, phone, or write to at least once a month?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Associates Contacted per Month

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - How many friends do you visit, phone, or write to at least once a month?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Friends Contacted per Month

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - With how many strangers have you initiated a conversation in the last month?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Strangers Spoke with Last Month

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Approximately what was the combined annual income, in the last year, of all family members in your household?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Combined Household Income Last Year

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Approximately how much did you pay last year for medical care expenses?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Medical Care Expenses Last Year

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Cognitive independence subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Cognitive Independence Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Economic self-sufficiency subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Economic Self-Sufficiency Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Mobility subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Mobility Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Occupation subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Occupation Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Physical independence subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Physical Independence Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Social integration subscore used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Social Integration Subscore for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form Questionnaires Parameter Code Terminology

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form Questionnaires Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique-Short Form Questionnaires Parameter Name Terminology

CodeList.Name: Date Imputation Flag

Description.TranslatedText: Date Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a date value.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Day Imputed: Day is imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Day Imputed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Month Imputed: Month and day are imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Month Day Imputed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Year Imputed: Entire date (year, month and day) is imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Year Month Day Imputed

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Date Imputation Flag Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Derivation Type: Analysis value derivation method.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's average value over a defined set of records.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Average of Value Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best possible outcome.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Best Case Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing baseline observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Baseline Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the best outcome recorded within a subject.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Best Observed Case Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous best-case non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Best Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A technique that uses assignment logic to duplicate an analysis value to be used in additional evaluations.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Copy Duplication Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to an estimation of a value based on extending a known sequence of values.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Extrapolation Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to one half of the lower limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: One Half of Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to a function of known values to estimate a value within the range.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Interpolation Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of detection of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Detection Limit

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the lower limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Lower Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's previous non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Last Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last recorded non-missing observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Last Observed Value Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's last observed value prior to the start of study treatment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Last Value Prior to Dosing Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's maximum value over a defined set of records.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Maximum Value Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's minimum value over a defined set of records.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Minimum Value Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the estimate that maximizes the probability of observing what has in fact been observed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Maximum Likelihood Estimation

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value from a comparator or reference group.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Mean of Other Group Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Mean Observed Value in a Group
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the mean value observed in a group of subjects.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Mean Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A technique that creates a record with a missing analysis value when there is no observed record for a given analysis visit or analysis timepoint.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Phantom Record Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's next-to-last non-missing value.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Penultimate Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's non-missing screening observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Screening Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of detection of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Upper Limit of Detection Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the upper limit of quantification of a test.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Upper Limit of Quantification Derivation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst possible outcome.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Case Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst recorded outcome within a subject.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Observed Case Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the subject's worst-case non-missing observation.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Observation Carried Forward Imputation Technique

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Worst Observed Value in a Group
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A data derivation or imputation technique which sets the analysis value on the record to the worst value observed in a group of subjects.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Worst Observed Value in a Group Imputation Technique

CodeList.Name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Code

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 - Total Score for Analysis

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 Version 2 Questionnaire Parameter Name Terminology

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Code Terminology

CodeList.Name: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter name codelist for the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form questionnaire (GDS02) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form Questionnaire Parameter Name Terminology

CodeList.Name: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Code

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter code codelist for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification (HAMD 17) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Code Terminology

CodeList.Name: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Name

Description.TranslatedText: A parameter name codelist for the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification (HAMD 17) to support the calculation of total score in ADaM.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item - Total score used for analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item - Total Score for Analysis

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Hamilton Depression Rating Scale - 17 Item Clinical Classification Parameter Name Terminology

Description.TranslatedText: Parameter Type: Indicates whether the parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Derived: Indicates that a parameter is derived as a function of one or more other parameters.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Derived Flag

CodeList.Name: Pool for Integration

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the name of the Pool, often defined in the integrated statistical analysis plan, which identifies the combination of subjects' clinical trial experience and will be the focus of the integrated analysis.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The pool that includes data across all studies within which the subject has participated, used for the overall integrated analysis.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Overall Pooled Data

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Pool for Integration Terminology

CodeList.Name: Subject Trial Status

Description.TranslatedText: Indicates the status of the subject in the trial.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Complete

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Discontinue

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption. (NCI)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Continue

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Subject Trial Status Terminology

CodeList.Name: Time Imputation Flag

Description.TranslatedText: Time Imputation Flag: Indicates the level of imputation reflected in a time value.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Hours Imputed: Entire time (hours, minutes and seconds) is imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Hours Minutes Seconds Imputed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Minutes Imputed: Minutes and seconds are imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Minutes Seconds Imputed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Seconds Imputed: Seconds are imputed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Seconds Imputed

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC ADaM Time Imputation Flag Terminology
